page.title: 06INTERESTING LOCAL PEOPLE 2
page.content: Sir Leonard although officially retired still takes an active part in social and professional activities in the district and chairs many worthy and varied societies and institutes. Another interesting character interviewed by the research group, having lived in Ireleth for the past 12 years and who previously resided in Askam for 36 years, naturally has firm views on the environment. This local resident, Mr. Bleasdale, remembers Askam when there were just a few houses and he attended St. Peters School in Ireleth, which was much smaller than it is today. This school, though small compared with some modern standards, however, does, in fact, contain a plaque mentioning the original Domesday Book Survey. Ireleth is the older of the two villages.
